alert.note: Alert for Bronx (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 11:49AM EST until December 19 at 6:20PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Bronx and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. The Bronx River remains in minor flood stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - The Bronx River remains in minor flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Rochelle, White Plains, East Tremont, Port Chester, Rye, Throgs Neck Bridge, Greenwich, Co-op City, Scarsdale, Bronxville, City Island, Mount Vernon, Eastchester, Mamaroneck, Greenville, Pelham, Woodlawn, Tuckahoe, Larchmont and Pelham Manor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
